data.name: FTPMissingServerOrUser.Text
data.value: You should specify at least the FTP server name and user name.

data.name: lblFtpPassiveMode.Help
data.value: Use passive mode data connection (otherwise active mode will be used). Note that active and passive refer to the operation of the FTP server, not the client.

data.name: lblFtpRemoteFolder.Help
data.value: Where to upload the files on the remote folder (e.g. /backupfiles/mysitebackup). Note: you can leave this setting empty to upload to the default folder.

data.name: lblFtpServer.Help
data.value: FTP server name or IP address (e.g. ftp.myothersite.com)

data.name: lblPerformFtpTransfer.Help
data.value: Enable this setting to transfer the backup file(s) via FTP to the configured FTP server. Note: An existing file will be overwritten / Old files will not be purged.

data.name: valBackupFileMaxCount.Text
data.value: Should be greater or equal than zero

data.name: FeatureUnavailable.Text
data.value: Feature unavailable in your current environment.

data.name: valCompressionBuffer.Text
data.value: Valid buffer sizes are from 64 to 20480 bytes.

data.name: AmazonS3TestError.Text
data.value: Amazon S3 connection test completed with errors:

data.name: lblAmazonBucketName.Help
data.value: Type the name of an already created Bucket. E.g. "mybucketname". Use any Amazon S3 GUI front-end application to configure your buckets, permissions, etc. e.g. you can use CloudBerry S3 Explorer Freeware from www.cloudberrylab.com, S3Fox Organizer(S3Fox) from www.s3fox.net, etc.

data.name: lblAmazonFileNamePattern.Help
data.value: This is how the files will be named in you Amazon S3 bucket. The [backupfile] token will be replaced with the backup file name. You can also specify 'folders'. e.g. DNNBackup/[backupfile]

data.name: lblAmazonFileNamePattern.Text
data.value: Backup File Name Pattern (S3 key name)

data.name: lblAmazonS3Info.Text
data.value:
• Don't have an Amazon S3 account? Create an account
  • You can manage your account, access keys and review account activity online at http://aws.amazon.com/account
  • NOTE: DNNBackup will upload your backup file(s) to an already created account and 'bucket'. You can manage your account, buckets permissions, etc. from any Amazon S3 GUI front-end application, like AWS Management Console:, CloudBerry S3 Explorer Freeware www.cloudberrylab.com, S3Fox Organizer(S3Fox) www.s3fox.net, etc.

data.name: lblAmazonSecretAccessKey.Help
data.value: Your Amazon's Secret Access Key. For your protection, you should never share your secret access keys with anyone.

data.name: lblPerformAmazonS3Transfer.Help
data.value: Enable this setting to transfer the backup file(s) to the configured Amazon's S3 bucket. Note: An existing file will be overwritten / Old files will not be purged.

data.name: lblAmazonBucketNameNotice.Text
data.value: Note: To conform with DNS requirements, bucket name (3 to 255 characters long) must contain lowercase letters only.

data.name: lblDeleteFileAfterFTP.Help
data.value: To save space, deletes the local file(s) after the FTP transfer was completed.

data.name: lblDeleteFileAfterS3.Help
data.value: To save space, deletes the local file(s) after the S3 transfer was completed.

data.name: CloudFilesTestError.Text
data.value: Rackspace CloudFiles connection test completed with errors:

data.name: lblCloudFilesContainerName.Help
data.value: Type the name of an already created Container. E.g. "mycontainername". Manage your containers from the Rackspace's Manager Console.

data.name: lblCloudFilesContainerNameNotice.Text
data.value: Note: container name cannot contain a forward slash, “/” character and must be less than 256 bytes in length.

data.name: lblCloudFilesFileNamePattern.Help
data.value: This is how the files will be named in you CloudFiles container. The [backupfile] token will be replaced with the backup file name. You can also specify 'folders'. e.g. DNNBackup/[backupfile]

data.name: lblCloudFilesInfo.Text
data.value:
• Don't have a Rackspace CloudFiles account? Create an account
  • NOTE: DNNBackup will upload your backup file(s) to an already created account and 'container'. You can manage your account, container permissions, etc. from your Rackspace's Manager Console https://manage.rackspacecloud.com.

data.name: lblDeleteFileAfterCloudFiles.Help
data.value: To save space, deletes the local file(s) after the CouldFiles transfer was completed.

data.name: lblPerformCloudFilesTransfer.Help
data.value: Enable this setting to transfer the backup file(s) to the configured CloudFiles' container. Note: An existing file will be overwritten / Old files will not be purged.

data.name: lblFtpServerPort.Help
data.value: FTP port (21 is the standard FTP port, and 22 is the standard SFTP port).

data.name: DropBoxAuthorizationMessage.Text
data.value:
DropBox Configuration

Next Steps:

  • You can close this window.
  • Click on the 'Establish Connection' link found on the configuration page (that you should have already open).
  • Save the Settings just configured by clicking on the 'Update' link found on the configuration page.

data.name: DropboxConnectionMissing.Message
data.value:
Your web site is not yet connected with your DropBox account.

  1. Click on the 'Request Connection' link. A new window, on DropBox's web site will be opened.
  2. A 'The app .... would like to connect with your Dropbox' dialog will be presented. Click on 'Allow' to start the authorization process that will grant your web site access to your DropBox account.
  3. Click on the 'Establish Connection' link found on this page.
  4. Save the Settings by clicking on the 'Update' link found on this page.

data.name: DropboxConnectionMissingAppKeyAndSecret.Message
data.value:
Please configure your 'App key' and 'App secret' (get them at https://www.dropbox.com/developers/apps). Then click on 'Update' and reload this form to continue with the authorization process.
Note: Read the long text find above for complete information about the authorization process.

data.name: DropboxMissingCredentials.Text
data.value:
Please check the provided DropBox Credentials.
If you haven't signed up for DropBox, please follow this procedure:
1) Go to https://www.dropbox.com/developers/apps, and login with your current DropBox account, or create a new account if you do not have any.
2) Click on "Create an App"
3) Give the new Application a name (like "example.com", where example.com is the web site you are connection to DropBox), and a Description (like "example.com connection").
4) Take note of the "App key" and "App secret" that DropBox created for you, and set them in this form.
Note: Don't worry about the "Additional Information", you can leave it blank.

data.name: lblDeleteFileAfterDropbox.Help
data.value: To save space, deletes the local file(s) after the Dropbox transfer was completed.

data.name: lblDropBoxAppKey.Help
data.value: The DropBox's "App key" you'll use to connect this web site.

data.name: lblDropBoxAppSecret.Help
data.value: The DropBox's "App secret" realated with the "App key".

data.name: lblDropBoxConnectionStatus.Help
data.value: Tells if for the given "App key" and "App secret", a connection with DropBox has been already established or not.

data.name: lblDropBoxFolder.Help
data.value: The Dropbox foder where the backup files will be saved. It should be like e.g. /mydropboxfolder.

data.name: lblDropboxInfo.Text
data.value:
Don't have a DropBox account? Click here to create an account.

Once you have a DropBox account, you'll have to Generate an 'App key' and 'App secret' values for this web site to connect with DropBox.
This is DropBox's policy regarding API connections from web sites/application. This web site will do not store and will don't even ask you for your DropBox user name and password.

How to generate an 'App key' and 'App secret':

  1. Go to https://www.dropbox.com/developers/apps, and login with your current DropBox account (or create a new account if you do not have any).
  2. Click on "Create App".
  3. Choose 'Dropbox API app', and then choose 'Files and datastores'.
  4. For 'Can your app be limited to its own, private folder?' choose 'Yes' or 'No' depending on your preferences.
  5. Give the new Application a name (like "example.com", where example.com is the web site you are connecting to DropBox), and a Description (like "example.com connection").
  6. Take note of the "App key" and "App secret" that DropBox created for you, and set them in this form.
    Note: Don't worry about the "Additional Information".
  7. Save the Settings by clicking on the 'Update' link found on this page, and re-open this form (Click on the pencil for this Folder Type on the 'Folder Type Definitions' dialog) to continue with the authorization process.

Once you have your 'App key' and 'App secret' keys, you can connect this web site to your DropBox account.

How to connect this web site with DropBox:

  1. Click on the 'Request Connection' link. A new window, on DropBox's web site will be opened.
  2. A 'The app .... would like to connect with your Dropbox' dialog will be presented. Click on 'Allow' to start the authorization process that will grant your web site access to your DropBox account.
  3. Click on the 'Establish Connection' link found on this page.
  4. Save the Settings by clicking on the 'Update' link found on this page.

NOTE: files over 300MB cannot be uploaded due to a Dropbox API limitation.

data.name: lblPerformDropboxTransfer.Help
data.value: Enable this setting to transfer the backup file(s) to the configured Dropbox folder. Note: An existing file will be overwritten / Old files will not be purged. In addition, notice that files over 300MB cannot be uploaded due to a Dropbox API limitation.

data.name: valDropBoxAppKey.Text
data.value: Please type your Access Key ID.

data.name: valDropBoxAppSecret.Text
data.value: Please type your Secret Access Key.

data.name: DropboxConnectionFailedToEstablish.Message
data.value:
Failed to establish the connection to Dropbox. Remeber to 'Request Connection' first, and that the request expires within minutes.
Error details: {0}

data.name: DropboxConnectionFailedToGetAuthorizationURL.Message
data.value:
Failed to get the Authorization URL. Please verify your App Key and App Secret are valid.
Error details: {0}

data.name: DropboxClearConnection.Message
data.value: Please remember to click on "Update" to confirm the drop action. Note: To really drop the connection, you must unauthorize the Application from your Dropbox account.

data.name: DropboxConnectionFailedToClear.Message
data.value: Failed to clear the Dropbox connection.

data.name: lblAzureAccessKey.Help
data.value: Your Windows Azures's primary or secondary Access Key Access Key. For your protection, you should never share it with anyone.

data.name: lblAzureAccountName.Help
data.value: Your Windows Azure Storage's Account Name.

data.name: lblAzureContainerName.Help
data.value: It is a container for objects stored in Windows Azure Storage.

data.name: lblAzureInfo.Text
data.value:
• Concerning DNNBackup, and regarding all the services provided under the 'Windows Azure' name, you just need a 'Storage Account'.

  • Don't have an Windows Azure Storage account? Click here to create an account, and click here to learn about How to Create a Storage Account for a Windows Azure Subscription.

  • You can manage your account at https://windows.azure.com/default.aspx.

  • Once you have created a 'Storage account' within you 'Azure Subscription', you can start creating 'Containers', which will hold your files (a.k.a 'Blobs').

  • From any Windows Azure GUI front-end application (like the Azure Storage Explorer, or CloudBerry Explorer for Azure), you can create/configure/manage your containers, permissions, files, and other settings.

data.name: lblDeleteFileAfterAzure.Help
data.value: To save space, deletes the local file(s) after the Windows Azure transfer was completed.

data.name: lblPerformAzureTransfer.Help
data.value: Enable this setting to transfer the backup file(s) to the configured Azure's container. Note: An existing file will be overwritten / Old files will not be purged.

data.name: AzureTestError.Text
data.value: Windows Azure connection test completed with errors:

data.name: lblAzureFileNamePattern.Help
data.value: This is how the files will be named in you Windows Azure Container. The [backupfile] token will be replaced with the backup file name. You can also specify 'folders'. e.g. DNNBackup/[backupfile]

data.name: valInvalidAzureContainerName.Text
data.value: Container names must be 3-63 characters in lenght and may contain lower-case alphanumeric characters and dashes. Dashes must be preceded and followed by an alphanumeric character.

data.name: lblUseSFTP.Help
data.value: Use Secure FTP (FTP over SSH) instead of the standard FTP protocol.

data.name: cmdClearConnectionBox.Message
data.value: Please remember to click on "Update" to confirm the drop action. Note: To really drop the connection, you must unauthorize the Application from your Box account.

data.name: lblBoxFolder.Help
data.value: The Box foder where the backup files will be saved. It should be e.g. like /myboxfolder.

data.name: lblBoxInfo.Text
data.value:
Don't have a Box account? Click here to create an account.

Once you have a Box account, you'll have to for this web site to connect with your Box account.
This is Box's policy regarding API connections from web sites/application. This web site will do not store and will don't even ask you for your BoxNet user name and password.

How to Create a new application:

  1. Go to http://www.box.com/developers/services, and login with your current Box account (or create a new account if you do not have any).
  2. Click on "Create new application" found below 'Developer Tools'.
  3. Give the new Application a name (like "example.com", where example.com is the web site you are connecting to Box), a Description (like "example.com connection"), and an email address.
  4. Take note of the "API key" Box created for you, and set it in this form.
  5. Save the Settings by clicking on the 'Update' link found on this page, and re-open this form (Click on the pencil for this Folder Type on the 'Folder Type Definitions' dialog) to continue with the authorization process.

Once you have your 'Api Key', you can connect this web site to your Box account.

How to connect this web site with Box:

  1. Click on the 'Request Connection' link. A new window, on BoxNet's web site will be opened.
  2. A '... is requesting that you log into your Box' dialog will be presented. Login into your account to start the authorization process that will grant your web site access to your Box account..
  3. Click on the 'Establish Connection' link found on this page.
  4. Save the Settings by clicking on the 'Update' link found on this page.

How to disconnect this web site from Box (how to disallow this web site from accessing your Box account):

  1. Use the 'Clear Connection' link found on this page to remove the link between Box and this web site.
  2. You can also delete the Box Application from 'My Applications' (http://www.box.com/services/browse/my)

data.name: lblBoxNetApplicationAPIKey.Help
data.value: The Box's "Application API Key" you'll use to connect this web site.

data.name: lblBoxNetAuthorizationToken.Help
data.value: The Box's "Authorization token" realated with the "API key".

data.name: lblBoxNetConnectionStatus.Help
data.value: Tells if for the given "API key", a connection with BoxNet has been already established or not.

data.name: lblDeleteFileAfterBox.Help
data.value: To save space, deletes the local file(s) after the Box transfer was completed.

data.name: lblPerformBoxTransfer.Help
data.value: Enable this setting to transfer the backup file(s) to the configured Box folder. Note: An existing file will be overwritten / Old files will not be purged. In addition, notice that you'll need a paid Box account in order to upload files >25Mb (any backup will be larger than this).

data.name: valBoxNetApplicationAPIKey.ErrorMessage
data.value: Please type your Box Application API Key.

data.name: valBoxNetAuthorizationToken.ErrorMessage
data.value: Please type your Box Authorization Token.

data.name: BoxNetCannotEstablishConnection.Message
data.value: The connection to Box could not be established. Error:

data.name: BoxNetCannotGetAuthorizationURL.Message
data.value: The Authorization URL could not be generated. Please verify the BoxNet application was created, and the provided App Key and Secret are valid. Error:

data.name: BoxNetConnectionFailedToClear.Message
data.value: Failed to clear the Box connection.

data.name: lblCloudFilesAccountLocation.Help
data.value: To access the Authentication Service, you must know whether your account is US-based or UK-based.
